answers.answer: Regular exercise helps control blood sugar in a lot of ways; most obviously, it helps the body burn off sugar because our muscles need it when they are being used.  Regular exercise also helps increase metabolism, maintain a proper weight, helps with proper blood circulation, and it also helps regulate hormones and chemicals in the brain that help us feel better and when we feel better, we tend to eat better and take better care of ourselves.As for the heart burning, sure it could be indigestion, but anyone with diabetes should report any kind of chest pain symptoms to their doc as soon as possible; remember that having diabetes already places us at risk for cardiac problems, so it's always best to be cautious and talk with your doc.
